page.title: 12Religion in Wistow area
page.content: The religious picture of the community is not encouraging. At the present time there is no Church operational in either Great or Little Raveley and this is due to falling attendances. Main religious belief in this area has always been Methodist and Church of England. Great Raveley used to have a Methodist Chapel but it has been demolished block by block and rebuilt in Warboys some 40-50 years ago. At Little Raveley the Church of England Church closed in recent years and has now been converted to a private residence. At Wistow the Baptist Chapel has closed and is now used as the Village Hall. People of all religious creeds in the area who wish to worship do so by travelling to Ramsey or Upwood. There are also people of the Catholic faith living in this area, they also travel to Ramsey.
